thread.title: Morning Roundup: Thirty-One Gifts will be back, Kasich up to 3rd in New Hampshire, milestone on the Columbus Coffee Trail
thread.title_full: Morning Roundup: Thirty-One Gifts will be back, Kasich up to 3rd in New Hampshire, milestone on the Columbus Coffee Trail

author: Doug Buchanan
title: Morning Roundup: Thirty-One Gifts will be back, Kasich up to 3rd in New Hampshire, milestone on the Columbus Coffee Trail
text:
4 photos Thirty-One Gifts brought about 10,000 visitors to downtown Columbus for its annual… more Thirty-One Gifts is coming back to Columbus next year. The direct-sales juggernaut wrapped up its national convention at Nationwide Arena on Monday, bringing in about 10,000 attendees for the three-day gathering. The company estimated the convention – the region's second-largest after the All American Quarter Horse Congress – had a $6.3 million economic impact on the city. The attendees included about 300 Canadian sales consultants, representing another growth area for the business . Thirty-One Gifts, with revenue of $643 million last year, already has about 4,200 consultants in Canada after an expansion push this year. It has about 112,000 sales reps in the U.S., including about 900 in Central Ohio. And it has about 1,500 employees in Columbus, Johnstown and Springfield. In addition to the main Columbus gathering next year, the company again will hold a regional convention for its growing presence out West, this time in Salt Lake City instead of Denver as it has the past couple years. John Kasich is surging in New Hampshire . The Ohio governor has jumped into the leadership pack in two new polls in the important early-primary state. The latest released Tuesday has Kasich tied for third in the state with support from 7 percent of likely Republican primary voters , Monmouth University reports, trailing Donald Trump at 24 percent and Jeb Bush at 12 percent. A different poll from a week ago also had him at 7 percent support, which the Cleveland Plain Dealer reports was good enough for fourth place in New Hampshire, although the poll was started before a big ad push in the state from Kasich allies . Our most-popular story yesterday was the first look at the latest plans for turning BalletMet's warehouse next to its downtown studios into about 70 apartments, including with a two-story glass penthouse added to the building . One of the bigger tax incentive deals approved Monday is bringing 1,500 jobs to southwest Ohio . The Cincinnati Business Courier reports Barclays Services LLC, a fast-growing issuer of Visa and MasterCard credit cards, plans to add 1,500 jobs at a call center it wants to set up in the region. It hasn't yet revealed its intended site, but that hasn't stopped the region's real estate players from guessing where it'll go . Miami University is already ready to add to its new student center . The Cincinnati Business Courier reports the Oxford school is finalizing plans for the second phase of the $53 million student center , with work beginning early next year if trustees approve. The next phase will add a wing by connecting the existing portion of the facility to Culler Hall. A cost hasn’t been estimated but the addition is being funded through donations and student fees. As it happens, a Thirty-One Gifts conventioneer helped tourism officials meet a milestone . Experience Columbus said Thirty-One Gifts consultant Lori Benseler became the 1,000th person to complete the Columbus Coffee Trail , a collection of eight downtown java shops that teamed together to encourage residents and visitors to sample their wares. Get your card stamped at four of them and Experience Columbus will give you a free T-shirt.
